chapters.title: The Ego
chapters.summary: The ego as the center of conscious identity, and its limits in relation to the greater psyche.

chapters.title: The Shadow
chapters.summary: Disowned psychic contents and the problem of projection as a developmental task.

chapters.title: The Syzygy: Anima and Animus
chapters.summary: The inner pair of opposites and how it shapes relationship to the unconscious and to others.

chapters.title: The Self
chapters.summary: The archetype of wholeness as a center ordering psychic life beyond ego control.

chapters.title: Christ, a Symbol of the Self
chapters.summary: A psychological reading of Christian symbolism as an image of the Self and the problem of excluded opposites.

chapters.title: The Sign of the Fishes
chapters.summary: Astrological and historical symbolism of the aeon, focusing on the fish motif and its tensions.

chapters.title: The Prophecies of Nostradamus
chapters.summary: Collective images, historical anxiety, and the psychological mechanisms that generate prophetic meaning.

chapters.title: The Historical Significance of the Fish
chapters.summary: How the fish motif accumulates meaning across time and becomes a carrier of psychic transformation.

chapters.title: The Ambivalence of the Fish Symbol
chapters.summary: The fish motif as a paradoxical image holding opposites, shadow, and eschatological tension.

chapters.title: The Fish in Alchemy
chapters.summary: Alchemical imagery as a symbolic language for transformation, with the fish as a motif of the opus.

chapters.title: The Alchemical Interpretation
chapters.summary: Psychological meaning of alchemical symbols and their relation to the union of opposites.

chapters.title: Background to the Psychology of Christian Alchemical Symbolism
chapters.summary: Method and framework for reading symbolic traditions psychologically without collapsing them into literalism.

chapters.title: Gnostic Symbols of the Self
chapters.summary: Gnostic motifs as symbolic approaches to the Self, including wisdom figures and paradox.

chapters.title: The Structure and Dynamics of the Self
chapters.summary: A culminating view of the Self, integrating earlier motifs into a coherent psychological picture.
